name: NPR
text:
French police are protesting after the country‚Äôs ban on chokeholds, saying they are being stigmatized in the wake of George Floyd‚Äôs death. 

"The police in France have nothing to do with the police in the U.S.," said the head of the main police union.
https://t.co/9RHSOQJCOh

name: NPR
text:
No, the U.S. has not entered a second wave of coronavirus infections.

Here's why we're stuck in a plateau ‚Äî and what forecasters say might come next.
https://t.co/ccEldZq6Ck

name: NPR
text:
RT @NPREmbedded: NEW EPISODE:

How do we go out but still stay safe as states reopen? This week we have stories of people navigating -- and in some cases disagreeing over --  their choices.

https://t.co/ASWbypeokp

name: NPR
text:
Fatal hemorrhaging is a serious risk for women in rural Africa who have to give birth at home. This inexpensive drug can help prevent it.

But fears that the drug might be used for abortion have kept it out of the hands of women who need it, experts say.
https://t.co/ko0A05EnUS

name: NPR
text:
A military contractor has abruptly laid off most of the Iraqi interpreters who served alongside the U.S. ‚Äî forcing some into hiding in fear of retaliation from ISIS and Iran-backed militias. 
https://t.co/L1dQMXK2G8

name: NPR
text: Former Georgia gubernatorial candidate Stacey Abrams says the state's Tuesday primary performance was "an unmitigated disaster" ‚Äî pinning the blame on Georgia's Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger.  https://t.co/SNKir6mkOs

name: NPR
text:
NASCAR has a long history with the Confederate flag but Bubba Wallace  ‚Äî the sports only black driver ‚Äî  says banning the flag will bring in people who felt uncomfortable before.
https://t.co/kz2xVo7dQA

name: NPR
text:
üöò  Is it OK to ride in a convertible? 

üêï  Are your dog‚Äôs paws putting you at risk? 

üß™  If you protested, should you get tested?

We‚Äôre answering your coronavirus questions üëá
https://t.co/YP6NtwvSG5

name: NPR
text:
Misdemeanors make up 80% of criminal arrests and cases in the U.S.

"This is the beginning of how we sweep people of color, and African Americans in particular, into our criminal system," says a law professor at the University of California at Irvine.
https://t.co/7FwMFllOx8

name: NPR
text:
A U.S. official confirmed to NPR the existence of a plan to draw down a portion of its armed forces based in Germany, but no orders have been issued. Russia welcomed the possible move.
https://t.co/GKVMFSnbGG

name: NPR
text:
The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences has announced new measures to expand diversity and inclusion within the filmmaking industry.
https://t.co/iQHNthB5Kx

name: NPR
text:
"The Help" has surged in popularity on Netflix, perhaps owing to its commitment to the idea that the personal matters most. 

But where injustices persist, that's a flawed idea at best.
https://t.co/NSjL223sE8

name: NPR
text:
After 25 seasons ‚Äî and renewed pressure to improve its diversity track record ‚Äî ‚ÄúThe Bachelor‚Äù will have its first black bachelor, 28-year-old Matt James.

The biggest question hanging over this moment is simple: Why did it take so long?
https://t.co/BLL6iYeCzn

name: NPR
text:
Shortly before his death, John Prine sat down to record one last plainspoken reflection, "I Remember Everything."

It's a humble but wide-ranging, deeply graceful look back for an artist who knows his end is approaching.
https://t.co/jZJUXRPLrt

name: NPR
text: Alabama is one of several states straining under a new burst of coronavirus hospitalizations. An epidemiologist tells @WBHM that the timing suggests this spike is a result of Memorial Day gatherings. https://t.co/yK0B2kPadh

name: NPR
text:
The haunting "Strange Fruit" has often been called into use to invoke the need for change in the face of America's greatest sins.

Today, Bettye LaVette brings the song back to the center of the conversation.
https://t.co/sb8XMEDIae

name: NPR
text: President Trump has announced he is moving his campaign rally planned for June 19 in Tulsa, Oklahoma to June 20. He has faced fierce criticism for holding the event on Juneteenth, the holiday that commemorates the effective end of slavery in the U.S. https://t.co/O350KLJkb6

name: NPR
text:
The TV and film industry resumed production Friday with new health and safety protocols in place ‚Äî including no craft service buffets, and fight scenes and "intimate scenes" are discouraged.
https://t.co/D3oatdXOCW

name: NPR
text:
Albert has been taking his son Aidan to protests against racial injustice since he was 6. At @StoryCorps, the two talk about the importance of protesting as a universal cause.

"The hardest part is knowing that could have been me," says Aidan, now 14.
https://t.co/fjIk1ZHo45

name: NPR
text:
From Eighth Blackbird's Beatles-inspired album to Chloe x Halle‚Äôs sonic delight, here are the best new albums out now. üéß
https://t.co/TUbBqplbpr

name: NPR
text:
The Library of Congress has commissioned 10 new compositions about the pandemic.

The project is named after Giovanni Boccaccio, who wrote a book about 10 people who flee the Black Death and tell stories in a remote refuge.
https://t.co/OsFl3ASOE5

name: NPR
text:
Activists have been covering a statue of Gen. Robert E. Lee in Richmond, Va., with graffiti and posing for photos.

"The standing in front of it, the dancing ‚Äî it symbolizes a level of freedom that black people have never had before," said one man.
https://t.co/18VyUaWtQu

name: NPR
text:
The EPA has ordered Amazon and eBay to stop selling certain pesticide-containing products, many of which falsely claimed to fight off and disinfect from the coronavirus.
https://t.co/QYslTVpcba

name: NPR
text:
When it comes to the justice system in Omaha, Neb., an organizer says protesters want changes large and small.

"I believe that in order to build a system that works for all people you have to dismantle the system that is inherently corrupt," she says.
https://t.co/agWtaMIyUv

name: NPR
text:
Prosecutors in Italy are investigating whether regional or national authorities mismanaged the response to the coronavirus as it quickly spread through northern Italy.
https://t.co/ooKNQB9m2w
